FuncDef: The display dot1x quiet-user command displays information about 802.1X authentication users who are quieted. The display dot1x quiet-user command displays information about 802.1X authentication users who are quieted. This command is supported only on the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K and CE6820S.

ParaDef.Info:
Displays information about all 802.1X authentication users in quiet state.
-

Displays information about an 802.1X authentication user in quiet state with a specified MAC address.
The value is in the H-H-H format. H is a 4-bit hexadecimal number, such as 00e0 or fc01. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0. The MAC address cannot be set to FFFF-FFFF-FFFF.

ExtraInfo: You can run this command to view information about 802.1X authentication users who are quieted.
